channel.title: Help needed
channel.description: Ok, so i used to code a bit. After i quit a couple years back i got a new comp and has nothing on it. But what i need help with, is i downloaded the jdk (oracle has made everything a lot more difficult), but its not letting me read .class files, .gui or any other file needed to update to be able to change anything. I was gonna check out the gazaascape 562, but its having errors when i run. And i cant change anything. Please help, Thanks.

item.title: Help needed
item.dc:creator: @Demo1 Demo_
item.description:
@Demo1 wrote:

aurocaido:

I can do that easily, but i see now how its set up. I was looking in the wrong folder… So how should i look at and edit .java files? after i can do that i should be good to go. (thanks for the help btw)

I highly doubt that you’ve ever programmed. Right click>edit.

Read full topic

item.title: Help needed
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

aurocaido:

I can do that easily, but i see now how its set up. I was looking in the wrong folder… So how should i look at and edit .java files? after i can do that i should be good to go. (thanks for the help btw)

use notepad like a boss.

item.title: Help needed
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

aurocaido:

haha tried to forget most of it, thought it was a no lifer kinda thing and quit… ive never worked on anyhing over 459… EVER. but i really wanted to try this gazaascape out, and i truly do not understand that completely… I just wanna be able to double click files and have them open like i could a while back. I cant make any edits or even get the game to run because its not letting me view ANYthing. Java, .class, anything at all. and the files that need to be edited in the source are all .class files, what do i need to do?

Sounds very…Leecher/noobish.

As i recall, Gazzascape is set to the ip 127.0.0.1, so nothing needs to be changed, all you need to do is change the java version in the .bat files to yours, and run the server before the client so you dont get the j5_connect error.

If you cant do this, you shouldn’t be programming.

Read full topic

item.title: Help needed
item.dc:creator: @aurocaido aurocaido
item.description:
@aurocaido wrote:

haha tried to forget most of it, thought it was a no lifer kinda thing and quit… ive never worked on anyhing over 459… EVER. but i really wanted to try this gazaascape out, and i truly do not understand that completely… I just wanna be able to double click files and have them open like i could a while back. I cant make any edits or even get the game to run because its not letting me view ANYthing. Java, .class, anything at all. and the files that need to be edited in the source are all .class files, what do i need to do?

Read full topic

item.title: Help needed
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:2, topic:434833”]Firstly you don’t read .class files, you read .java files and compile them into .class files. The “runner” reads the .class files.

Idk about .gui files as I do not know what they are.[/quote]
This reminds me of the time years ago when i thought i was badass, and opened pictures with notepad and edited them.

OP: there is no such thing as the .gui extension, BUT in the Client side (depending on the base) there is sometimes a GUI.java file…Sounds to me like you never programmed ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Help needed
item.dc:creator: @arve arve
item.description:
@arve wrote:

Ofcourse if you want to read a class file you could download a decompiler but as the guy over me said. You write the java. file and it compiles into a class.file.

Read full topic

item.title: Help needed

item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Firstly you don’t read .class files, you read .java files and compile them into .class files. The “runner” reads the .class files.

Idk about .gui files as I do not know what they are.
